intro: Senecio zoellneri, commonly known as the Zoellner's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
